meanings.definition: To burn or sear with a hot iron or caustic substance.
meanings.sent1: The doctor had to cauter the wound to stop the bleeding.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, they cauter wounds to prevent infections.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally cauterized the steak, making it too tough to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to cauter his heart, leaving him feeling numb.
meanings.sent5: The image of the burning iron was enough to cauter the memory in his mind.

meanings.definition: A substance or instrument used for cauterizing.
meanings.sent1: The cauter was carefully prepared before the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The ancient cauters were made of iron and heated in fire.
meanings.sent3: The misplaced cauter in the medical kit made the nurse chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The cauter gleamed under the bright lights of the operating room.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the cauter lingered in the air, reminding him of the procedure.
